channel.title: Just Wondering
channel.description: I was just wondering, what would be a suitable career choice for a fellow that wants to have plenty of leisure time for programming and physical activity? I've brainstormed and all of the career choices seem nearly impossible. I'd like some decent responses. Thanks everyone that contributes.

item.title: Just Wondering
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Work on a oil platform in the North Sea. (Or anywhere else where you work 2 weeks followed by 3-4 weeks of free time.)

Read full topic

item.title: Just Wondering
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“jagman, post:6, topic:475253”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=593354.msg4186381#msg4186381 date=1356215128]
School teacher. Summer = 3 months of programming + physical activity.
[/quote]Looking for a bit more lenient amount of time for constructive programming.

[quote author=reyx7 link=topic=593354.msg4186377#msg4186377 date=1356214778]
A number of office jobs nowadays will pay for an employee’s gym membership. For that specific combo, it’s hard to tell. What did you have in mind?
[/quote]Nothing but idiotic choices in mind.[/quote]

Teaching gives you all the holidays paid, with a good pay. you work until 4-4:30pm which gives you heaps of free time.

Read full topic

item.title: Just Wondering
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Just get a programming job so you’d only have to worry about free time to do physical stuff - which is pretty much a guarantee.

Read full topic
